I am aware that the conditions in Moylough national school, County Sligo are unsatisfactory, and I am arranging for my Department's professional advisers to investigate and make recommendations as to what work, if any, might be carried out at the existing school by way of short term improvements to ameliorate conditions there pending the provision of the proposed new school.

Because of the pressures on the capital available to my Department for the national school building programme, I am not in a position to make a financial allocation in 1988 towards the cost of the proposed new school. This information has already been conveyed to the chairman of the school's board of management by an officer of my Department. No decision has yet been made as to the possibility of financial allocation in this case in 1989 or 1990.

asked the Minister for Education if she will make the necessary arrangements in order that St. Brendan's national school, Cartron Point, County Sligo, will be allocated an eighth teacher, in time to start when the school resumes in January 1988, in view of the fact that (a) St. Brendan's is entitled to this teacher through the numbers attending over the required period (b) the undertaking given by her in the recently published action plan (c) that this is a new developing school and now has children in classes of 40 to 44 and (d) that the classroom is available.

asked the Minister for Education if time constraints, holidays or any work on documentation prevents her Department from being in a position to appoint an eighth teacher to St. Brendan's national school, Cartron Point, County Sligo, from January 1988 to which it is entitled on the basis of the numbers over the required period; and if she will take the necessary steps to ensure that it is given a temporary teacher in a provisional capacity who would start work when the school resumes in January 1988, in accordance with the usual practice and procedures in such cases.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 265 and 266 together.
The application of the school authorities for the appointment of an additional teacher at this school is under consideration in my Department and they will be written to as soon as possible.

asked the Minister for Education the plans, if any, she has for the provision of extra improvements and facilities at the No. 2 national school, Celbridge, County Kildare; if she has satisfied herself that adequate fire safety and health requirements can be met by the existing building; the current state of negotiations between the school manager and her Department in regard to the provision of extra facilities; the remaining requirements on either side; when it will be possible to allow the project to proceed if there is sufficient finance to allow the project to proceed in 1988; if obstacles other than finance exist; the way in which she proposes to ensure that this community is assured its basic right to a proper modern school; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The application for grant aid from the No. 2 national school Celbridge, County Kildare, concerns a plan to refurbish and extend an existing national school building which they have acquired. A sketch scheme submitted by the school is acceptable in principle to my Department. Because, however, of the pressure on the capital available to my Department for the national schools building programme, I will not be in a position in the coming financial year to provide finance for the project, or to authorise the next step in the architectural process, which is the preparation of tender documentation.

I accept that the condition of the buildings at present occupied by the school is unsatisfactory. The authorities have not asked my Department to consider specifically the fire safety and health factors mentioned by the Deputy. However, I am asking my Department's professional advisers to discuss these matters with the school authorities to establish whether any financial assistance could be made available to them in the short term to enable them to improve existing conditions pending the provision of the major building scheme.
asked the Minister for Education what the staffing position will be in June 1988 at the national school at Muinnefliuch, Carraiganime, County Cork.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: My Department are not in a position to say at present what the staffing position of Muinnefliuch national school will be in June 1988. This will depend on the average enrolments at the school in the meantime.
asked the Minister for Education when a new directive will be issued by her Department to all primary schools indicating clearly the present official status of Circular 20/87.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: A circular on the matter issued to primary schools on 10 December 1987.

asked the Minister for Education if it is proposed to continue the 100 per cent funding of scoileanna lán-Gaelacha as heretofore; the amount to be so allocated in 1988; and her views on this policy in view of the position regarding capital programmes for construction of gnáth bunscoileanna in 1988.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: There are no proposals to depart from the policy of offering to recognised scoileanna náisiúnta lán-Ghaelacha in non-Gaeltacht areas 100 per cent grants towards the capital cost of providing sites and permanent accommodation to serve their long term needs. Grants to such schools towards the cost of temporary accommodation, or of improvements to existing accommodation, will as heretofore be subject to payment of a negotiable local contribution.

The overall capital allocation in 1988 for buildings for scoileanna náisiúnta lán-Ghaelacha has not yet been decided. I am in a position to say, however, that sufficient capital will be allocated in 1988 as a matter of priority for continuing grant payments to a number of these schools which in the coming year will be either still under construction or at final account stage.

asked the Minister for Education if she has satisfied herself that primary teacher training is of a sufficiently high standard to enable all teachers so trained to teach in either bunscoileanna or scoileanna lán-Gaelacha to minimum departmental requirements.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I am satisfied that the course of training provided in our colleges of education meet the requirements for teacher appointments in all national schools, including scoileanna lán-Gaelacha.

asked the Minister for Education if she proposes to apply the same criteria for pupil/teacher ratio and school transport as apply at present to scoileanna lán-Gaelacha, to all other primary schools; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

asked the Minister for Education if her attention has been drawn to the fact some primary schools are depleted in numbers due to the transport scheme that operates in scoileanna lán-Gaelacha; and if she will make a statement regarding the fact that the normal regulation of attending one's nearest primary school is waived in respect of attendance at scoileanna lán-Gaelacha.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I propose to take Questions Nos. 272 and 273 together.
I have no proposals to extend the staffing concession for all-Irish national schools to all national schools.

Eligibility for school transport is determined by reference to the nearest suitable school. For those who wish to attend an all-Irish school, the nearest all-Irish school is regarded as being the nearest suitable school. I do not propose to change this arrangement.
I have seen no evidence that any schools have been adversely affected by the operation of the school transport scheme in relation to all-Irish schools.

asked the Minister for Education if she will indicate the way in which it is proposed to operate school transport services to the 1987 levels in view of a proposal to reduce allocation thereto by 19 per cent in 1988.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The school transport service will operate as heretofore from January 1988. However, as the Deputy will be aware, the relevant scheme is under continuing review in my Department.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: An application for such appointment has been received from the Chairman of the Board of Management and my Department will be writing to him in the matter shortly.

asked the Minister for Education if tenders have been invited for the extension of a school (details supplied) in Cork city for which a grant was sanctioned in 1985 and for which detailed contract documents were prepared in 1986; and, if so, when building will commence.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Tenders have not been invited for the extension of the school referred to. Because of the pressure on the funds available to my Department for the schools building programme, I am not in a position at present to allow the project to advance to tender action stage.
asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the proposed extension to Carrick national school, County Donegal.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The present position regarding the proposed extension to Carrick national school, County Donegal, is that the school authorities have submitted tenders for the project. Because, however, of the pressure on the funds available to my Department for the national schools building programme, I am not in a position at present to approve the further processing of the tenders or to authorise the placing of a contract.
asked the Minister for Education the amount of revenue which has been achieved from school transport charges each year since their introduction, including 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The total amounts realised by way of school transport charges since their introduction in January 1983 are as follows: 1983, £2,253,000; 1984, £2,444,000; 1985, £2,957,000; 1986, £3,346,000; 1987, £3,521,000.
asked the Minister for Education if she recently wrote to the staff in Scoil Muire, Killorglin, County Kerry informing them that a teaching position would be terminated on 31 December 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: A member of the school staff was informed of the conditions relating to the continuance of her post.
asked the Minister for Education if she issued a letter to the Christian Brothers' school, Dingle, County Kerry informing the staff that they would be losing a teaching post on 31 December 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: There is no record in my Department that such a letter issued.
asked the Minister for Education if she recently issued a letter to Rathmore national school, County Kerry, informing the staff that they would be losing a teaching post on 31 December 1987.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: A member of the school staff was informed of the conditions relating to the continuance of his post.

asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the proposed new primary school for Kilcummin, Killarney, County Kerry; whether she has proposals to extend the existing school; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The Deputy is understood to refer to my Department's approval in principle to grant-aid the cost of the extension of and certain improvements to the primary school at Kilcummin, Killarney, County Kerry. Tender documentation for the project has been prepared but because of pressure on the capital resources available to my Department for the national schools building programme, I am not in a position to say when tenders for the project may be invited.
Meanwhile, my Department have under consideration an application from the school authorities for grant-aid towards the cost of improvements to existing facilities at the school.

Speaker.hpid: Proinsias De Rossa Proinsias De Rossa
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the contents of any regulation or guidelines that govern the minimum classroom space, heating and fire regulations, relating to primary schools.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: In relation to the minimum classroom space in primary schools. I would refer the Deputy to the reply which I gave on 15 October 1987 to a question raised by Deputy Tom Fitzpatrick.

I understand the Deputy to be raising the question of heating and fire regulations mainly in the context of designing and building primary schools. while the Rules for National Schools make no direct reference to these subjects, building projects for which grants are sought from my Department must be professionally designed, approved and executed in accordance with the planning data issued by my Department to the consultants involved. It can also be taken that heating systems and fire safety features would have to be in accordance with the specifications required by the relevant local authority services.

With regard to the responsibilities of boards of management in these matters, I would refer the Deputy to the reply which I gave on 3 December 1987 to a question raised by Deputy Tomás Mac Giolla on the subject of heating levels in national schools. The subject of fire danger is dealt with in departmental Circular 7/81 which urges boards of management to draw attention to the dangers of fire and recommends that fire drills should be carried out regularly.

asked the Minister for Education whether any cost saving measures in the primary sector were discussed with representatives or officials of the Irish National Teachers Organisation prior to the Government's decision in relation to changes in class sizes.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: No such discussions took place.
asked the Minister for Education whether teachers of special classes in primary schools are excluded from the provisions of the modified Circular 20/87; and, if not, the reason.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The terms of Circular 20/87 do not apply to special classes in national schools.

Speaker.P: It is proposed that appointments under existing schedules of averages would be on a temporary basis pending consideration by the Quota Review Committee.

asked the Minister for Education whether, in view of her reply to Parliamentary Question No. 208 of Tuesday, 8 December 1987 teachers who must apply under the voluntary redundancy scheme prior to 31 January next may not have their application decided upon until after the end of the present school year.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: It is intended that offers of redundancy will be made in the months of April, May and June.
asked the Minister for Education if work will start on the proposed new national school for Ballymote, County Sligo in 1988; and if not, when it will start.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Because of the pressures on the capital available to my Department for the national schools building programme, it will not be possible for the present to advance the architectural planning of the proposed additional accommodation for the Ballymote national schools, County Sligo. MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Drogheda (Louth) School.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if her Department's attention has been drawn to the difficult problems which exist at Scoil Aonghusa, Sráid na Maoran, Drogheda, County Louth due to severe overcrowding; if the school was advised that one extra teacher would be appointed when the number of pupils reached 175; if she is aware that since 1 September 1987 the number has reached 184 being 38 to 40 per class; if this problem is made more difficult because they have to operate in temporary rented accommodation where the rooms are very small and therefore unhealthy; whether this is an acceptable situation for teachers and pupils; the steps she proposes to take to urgently rectify this serious matter; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The rules for the appointment of an additional teacher at this school are not fulfilled at present. However, an application from the school authorities for such appointment would be considered, should the required average enrolment be reached for the quarter ended 31 December 1987.

MainHeading.P: With regard to the question of accommodation, my Department has approved in principle the provision of the usual grant towards the cost of providing permanent accommodation for the school. Because however, of the pressure on the capital available to my Department for the national schools building programme, I am not in a position at this stage to provide a financial allocation for the project. I am asking my Department's professional officers to inquire whether it may be possible with grant assistance from my Department to improve conditions at the existing premises pending the provision of permanent accommodation.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when she proposes to approve finance for the extension to Williamstown national school, County Galway; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Because of the pressure on the capital available to my Department for the national schools building programme, I will not be in a position during the coming financial year to provide funds for the planned extension to Williamstown national school, County Galway. I am, however, arranging for the Primary Buildings Branch of my Department to look into the question of whether any improvements could be carried out within the current constraints on capital spending whereby conditions at the school could be alleviated pending the provision of the proposed extension.
